list_definition.definition: (a block of) baked clay used for building

list_ex_of_english: Dry-pressed bricks were as smooth and regular as hand-dressed or re-pressed products, but they did not need a separate period of drying.
We all - including those making the bricks - have a stake in the outcome.
The other buildings analysed here have outer walls with three bricks up to the first floor, above which they are reduced to two bricks only.
The basic bricks are cells that can be filled by values.
Cess-pits began to be lined with bricks and cement and covered over.
In the crucial case of building, for example, more licences to build were issued than could be matched by the availability of bricks.
The size of the building implied by three bedrooms and the cost of fireproof bricks effectively made reformed cottages too expensive to build except as models.
When one puts bricks onto a truck beyond the capacity of that truck, that act is detrimental to the truck.
